queries.sql: SELECT * FROM `tbl_position` WHERE `posID` = '1'

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. Obtain a lead schedule of intangible non-current assets and goodwill, showing the movement for each class of asset during the period. <b>(P)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Agree totals shown on the lead schedule to the trial balance<b>(E)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Review intangible non-current assets and goodwill for reasonableness and consistency. <b>(C & E)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <b>(P)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. Ensure that intangible assets acquired in a business combination are recognised separately from goodwill where they are identifiable and their fair value is reliably measurable. <b>(V, P)</b></p>', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Vouch a sample of additions to supporting documentation and ensure the expenditure has been appropriately capitalised. <b>(E, R & O)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Vouch a sample of disposals to sales invoices and receipts, and ensure that the profit / loss on disposal has been correctly calculated. <b>(C, V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. For a sample of intangible non-current assets obtain evidence that these assets still exist by agreeing to contract, patent or other supporting documentation. Ensure that they are still generating cash flows or cash savings. <b>(E)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>12. Ensure that goodwill is not internally generated. Also, with the exception of development expenditure that meets the recognition criteria, ensure that internally generated intangible non-current assets have not been capitalised. <b>(E)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. Where development expenditure, when it is deemed to be probable that it will lead to an economic return, has been capitalised (research expenditure must always be expensed unless purchased or acquired as part of a business combination) agree capitalised expenditure costs (including finance costs where the option to capitalise these costs has also been taken) to backing documentation. Produce a working paper to justify why the recognition criteria for capitalisation has been met. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Recalculate the amortisation and assess the reasonableness of rates used. Ensure that for intangibles other than goodwill, ensure that the useful economic lives, residual values and amortisation methods adopted are reviewed by the directors annually. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. Consider whether there is any indication that intangible non-current assets or goodwill are impaired.<b> (E, V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Ensure that any impairment loss previously recognised against goodwill is not reversed in a subsequent period. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Ensure that intangible non-current assets are not revalued. <b>(V)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Ensure negative goodwill has been expensed through profit or loss when it arises.<b>(P)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Review board minutes during the period, and intangible non-current asset additions after the year end. For those items where there was a contractual agreement in place at the year end to acquire the asset, ensure that correct disclosure has been made of capital commitments. <b>(P)</b></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Where the entity has recognised research and development costs as an expense, ensure the total value of these costs been quantified and disclosed.<b>(P)</b> </p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.1 B2', '2.1 B2', '14', 'Active', '2024-04-09 20:12:31')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	Obtain a lead schedule of intangible non-current assets and goodwill, showing the movement for each class of asset during the period. <b>(P)</b></p>
    [1] => <p>2.	Agree totals shown on the lead schedule to the trial balance<b>(E)</b></p>

    [2] => <p>3.	Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <b>(V)</b></p>

    [3] => <p>4.	Review intangible non-current assets and goodwill for reasonableness and consistency. <b>(C & E)</b></p>

    [4] => <p>5.	Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>
    [6] => <p>7.	Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <b>(P)</b></p>

    [7] => <p>8.	Ensure that intangible assets acquired in a business combination are recognised separately from goodwill where they are identifiable and their fair value is reliably measurable. <b>(V, P)</b></p>
    [8] => <p>9.	Vouch a sample of additions to supporting documentation and ensure the expenditure has been appropriately capitalised. <b>(E, R & O)</b></p>

    [9] => <p>10.	Vouch a sample of disposals to sales invoices and receipts, and ensure that the profit / loss on disposal has been correctly calculated. <b>(C, V)</b></p>

    [10] => <p>11.	For a sample of intangible non-current assets obtain evidence that these assets still exist by agreeing to contract, patent or other supporting documentation. Ensure that they are still generating cash flows or cash savings.  <b>(E)</b></p>

    [11] => <p>12.	Ensure that goodwill is not internally generated. Also, with the exception of development expenditure that meets the recognition criteria, ensure that internally generated intangible non-current assets have not been capitalised. <b>(E)</b></p>

    [12] => <p>13.	Where development expenditure, when it is deemed to be probable that it will lead to an economic return, has been capitalised (research expenditure must always be expensed unless purchased or acquired as part of a business combination) agree capitalised expenditure costs (including finance costs where the option to capitalise these costs has also been taken) to backing documentation.  Produce a working paper to justify why the recognition criteria for capitalisation has been met. <b>(V)</b></p>

    [13] => <p>14.	Recalculate the amortisation and assess the reasonableness of rates used.  Ensure that for intangibles other than goodwill, ensure that the useful economic lives, residual values and amortisation methods adopted are reviewed by the directors annually. <b>(V)</b></p>

    [14] => <p>15.	Consider whether there is any indication that intangible non-current assets or goodwill are impaired.<b> (E, V)</b></p>

    [15] => <p>16.	Ensure that any impairment loss previously recognised against goodwill is not reversed in a subsequent period. <b>(V)</b></p>

    [16] => <p>17.	Ensure that intangible non-current assets are not revalued. <b>(V)</b></p>

    [17] => <p>18.	Ensure negative goodwill has been expensed through profit or loss when it arises.<b>(P)</b></p>

    [18] => <p>19.	Review board minutes during the period, and intangible non-current asset additions after the year end.  For those items where there was a contractual agreement in place at the year end to acquire the asset, ensure that correct disclosure has been made of capital commitments. <b>(P)</b></p>

    [19] => <p>20.	Where the entity has recognised research and development costs as an expense, ensure the total value of these costs been quantified and disclosed.<b>(P)</b> </p>

    [20] => <p>21.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
